intro: Conyza dichotoma, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa, Asia, and Australia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branched stems covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are alternate, narrow, and often have a hairy texture. Conyza dichotoma is known for its adaptability to various soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
